section.section: The responsibility for the management, general administration, and proper operation of the several systems is vested in the Board of Trustees.

The Board of Trustees is not responsible for:
reviewing the benefit structures for any of the several systems, except for the purpose of making technical corrections; or
considering benefit enhancements for any of the several systems.

Each trustee on the Board of Trustees is required to complete at least 8 hours of investment and fiduciary training, including training on fiduciary conduct and board governance, during a 1-year period beginning January 1.
The training shall be approved by the Chairman of the Board of Trustees to satisfy the 8-hour requirement under subparagraph (i) of this paragraph.

On or before June 30 and December 31 of each year, the State Retirement Agency shall submit a report to the Department of Legislative Services that provides a summary of the training required by paragraph (3) of this subsection that was completed by each trustee during that 6-month period.

On or before September 1 of each year, the Board of Trustees shall submit a report in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article to the Joint Committee on Pensions that provides:
a total of all travel expenses for the fiscal year ending immediately prior to September 1 for:
the destination, duration, and justification for the travel;
for members of the Board of Trustees, a statement whether the travel was made for purposes of fiduciary educational training; and
for staff of the Investment Division, a statement whether the travel was made for purposes of meeting with existing or prospective investment managers.

text.section: In addition to the Investment Committee established under § 21-114 of this subtitle, the Board of Trustees may establish other committees.
Subject to §§ 21-122 and 21-123 of this subtitle, the Board of Trustees shall have full power to invest the assets of the several systems.
